page.title: 14A SCHOOLTEACHER'S DAY
page.content: I arrive for work at 8.30. Along with several hundred other drivers I slowly make my way down the Lytham Road. All the other drivers turn in to British Aerospace, but I join my colleagues at Holy Family School. Our playground runs parallel with the British Aerospace runway; only a couple of rows of houses separate us. This morning while we were busy working, the Crown Prince of Saudia Arabia and Mr Norman Tebbit (Conservative MP) were signing a multi-million pound contract for the Tornado aeroplane. This ensures thousands of jobs until the end of the century and many of our parents will be relieved. The Red Arrows, the Royal Air Force's formation air team, are giving a display to clebrate this contract.It is phenomenal. Ribbons of blue and red smode thread their way across the sky.
